title: on demand paging
html:
Difference Between Normal Paging and Demand Paging

FeatureNormal PagingDemand Paging
Page LoadingAll required pages of a process are loaded into memory before execution.Pages are loaded only when accessed (on demand, causing a page fault).
Memory UsageHigher, as all pages are loaded upfront.Lower, as only needed pages are kept in memory.
Page FaultsFewer, since pages are preloaded.More initially, but reduces as required pages get loaded.
Execution Start TimeHigher, as loading all pages takes time.Lower, as only necessary pages are loaded at first.
EfficiencyCan lead to unused pages occupying memory.More efficient use of RAM, reducing wastage.

ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway:

  • Normal Paging â†’ Loads everything upfront.
  • Demand Paging â†’ Loads only what is needed, improving memory efficiency.
